DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to having a computed tomographic (CT) scan, a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis, being used to assess or evaluate the chest, the part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm, or abdomen, the area of the body that contains the pancreas, stomach, intestine, liver, gallbladder, and other organs._The upper jawbone in vertebrates; it is fused to the cranium._The anterior portion of the head extending from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear. The facial structures contain the eyes, nose and mouth, cheeks and jaws._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to having a computed tomographic (CT) scan, a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis, being used to assess or evaluate the chest, the part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm, or abdomen, the area of the body that contains the pancreas, stomach, intestine, liver, gallbladder, and other organs._The upper jawbone in vertebrates; it is fused to the cranium._The anterior portion of the head extending from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear. The facial structures contain the eyes, nose and mouth, cheeks and jaws.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Computed Tomography Maxilla Face Diagnostic Imaging
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.:The upper jawbone in vertebrates: it is fused to the cranium.:The anterior portion of the head extending from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear. The facial structures contain the eyes, nose and mouth, cheeks and jaws.:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
The upper jawbone in vertebrates; it is fused to the cranium.
The anterior portion of the head extending from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear. The facial structures contain the eyes, nose and mouth, cheeks and jaws.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk
